page.title: 16THE LOCAL LANGUAGE-DYKE
page.content: Some of the words used here may not be strictly local but are known especially to older locals. { Sea_piet}_oyster catcher { scutter}_time consuming job { skellet}_water ladle { Delted}_spoilt as in a spoilt child { Eeshan}_restless,niggling child { Boorach}_state of untidiness as in a house { Bourtree}_elder bush { Soorack}_sorrel plant { eideut}_industrious { Hooack}_small hay stack { Quickeus}_couch grass Locals of the Dyke Area speak with a pure vowel sound and no lilt in the voice.Local language is particularly interesting as the area lies between the broad tones of the east and the softer Highland notes a few kilometres west.
